title: ACCOMPLICE TO THE VILLAIN
author: Hannah Nicole Maehrer
description: The third book in the Assistant and the Villain series. Evie Sage might be falling for the kingdom’s most terrifying villain.

title: THE FALLEN & THE KISS OF DUSK
author: Carissa Broadbent
description: The fourth book in the Crowns of Nyaxia series and second book of the Shadowborn Duet.

title: ATMOSPHERE
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: In the summer of 1980, Joan Goodwin begins training with a group of candidates for NASA’s space shuttle program.

title: PROJECT HAIL MARY
author: Andy Weir
description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.

title: SCARRED
author: Emily McIntire
description: The second book in the Never After series. Lady Sara Beatreaux develops an attraction for one of the men she intended to kill.

title: COMING UP SHORT
author: Robert B. Reich
description: An economist who served in three presidential administrations gives his perspective on his generation’s impact on democracy, society and the economy.

title: ON POWER
author: Mark R. Levin
description: The Fox News host considers various facets of power and its effect on history.

title: ONE NATION ALWAYS UNDER GOD
author: Tim Scott
description: The Republican senator from South Carolina depicts the influence Christianity had on some prominent people and institutions.

title: DISNEY ADULTS
author: AJ Wolfe
description: An exploration of the subculture of loyal fans, composed of grown-ups, of the Disney films, merchandise and theme parks.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: DON'T BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU THINK, EXPANDED EDITION
author: Joseph Nguyen

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: ODDER
author: Katherine Applegate. Illustrated Charles Santoso
description: After a shark attack, Odder recuperates at the aquarium with the scientists who raised her. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: BLOOD IN THE WATER
author: Tiffany D. Jackson
description: Kaylani McKinnon investigates a mysterious death on Martha’s Vineyard. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE SMART COOKIE
author: Jory John. Illustrated Pete Oswald
description: Cookie builds up her self-confidence. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE PIGEON HAS TO GO TO SCHOOL!
author: Mo Willems
description: Pigeon deals with the anxieties of going to school for the first time. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: ON THE FIRST DAY OF KINDERGARTEN
author: Tish Rabe. Illustrated Laura Hughes
description: A little girl's first 12 days of kindergarten. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: THE CRAYONS GO BACK TO SCHOOL
author: Drew Daywalt. Illustrated Oliver Jeffers
description: The crayons go back to school and can't wait for art class. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
author: Jenny Han
description: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: DRAGON MASTERS
author: Tracey West
description: Drake, once skeptical of the existence of dragons, now trains his very own. (Ages 6 to 8)

title: GLORIOUS RIVALS
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: The stakes are raised for the seven players on Hawthorne Island. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: A THEORY OF DREAMING
author: Ava Reid
description: In the sequel to "A Study in Drowning," Effy and Preston return to the University of Llyr. (Ages 14 and up)

title: HOUR OF THE PUMPKIN QUEEN
author: Megan Shepherd
description: After a potion demonstration goes awry, Sally and Luna fall through a portal to Time Town. (Ages 12 and up)

title: IMMORTAL CONSEQUENCES
author: I.V. Marie
description: At Blackwood Academy, six students compete to change their fate in a cutthroat magical competition called the Decennial. (Ages 14 and up)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)
